metadata.Title: CVE-2019-20433 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - low.
metadata.Description: libaspell.a in GNU Aspell before 0.60.8 has a buffer over-read for a string ending with a single '\0' byte, if the encoding is set to ucs-2 or ucs-4 outside of the application, as demonstrated by the ASPELL_CONF environment variable.

notes.Note: leosilva> the fix proposed can potentially break applications that depends on it. mdeslaur> need to regenerate files after applying patch, see debian bug.

criterions.comment: aspell: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
